questions.question_text: Port security is statically configured on a Cisco Nexus 7700 Series switch and F3 line card. The switch is configured with an Advanced Services license. Which two actions delete secured MAC addresses from the interface? (Choose two.)
questions.answer_description:
Removing a Static Secure MAC Address on an Interface:
You can remove a static secure MAC address on a Layer 2 interface.
Switched port to routed port:
When you change an interface from a Layer 2 interface to a Layer 3 interface, the device disables port security on the interface and discards all port security configuration for the interface. The device also discards all secure MAC addresses for the interface, regardless of the method used to learn the address.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/6_x/nx-os/security/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_NX-
OS_Security_Configuration_Guide__Release_6-x/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide__Release_6-x_chapter_010001.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
A and E!

B and E are correct.

When you change an interface from a Layer 2 interface to a Layer 3 interface, the device disables port security on the interface and discards all port security configuration for the interface. The device also discards all secure MAC addresses for the interface, regardless of the method used to learn the address.

Dynamic Learning is the default learning method. To remove all addresses learned by the dynamic method, use the shutdown and no shutdown commands to restart the interface.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/6_x/nx-os/security/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide__Release_6-x/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide__Release_6-x_chapter_010001.html#steps_1131891-CLI

comments.content:
It's A and E.
B is incorrect. The MAC address is not dynamically learned. Take a look at the question : "Port security is STATICALLY configured...".

A static secure MAC address entry remains in the configuration of an interface until one of the following events occurs:
You explicitly remove the address from the configuration.
You configure the interface to act as a Layer 3 interface.

choices.A: The address must be removed from the configuration.
choices.C: The device must be restarted manually.
choices.D: The address must reach the age limit that is configured for the interface.
choices.E: The interface must be converted to a routed port.
choices.B: Shutdown and then no shutdown must be run on the interface.

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring AAA authentication on a Cisco MDS 9000 Series switch. The LDAP server is located under the IP 10.10.2.2. The data sent to the LDAP server should be encrypted. Which command should be used to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the one!

Selected Answer: D
Example: switch(config)# ldap-server host 10.10.2.2 enable-ssl
The enable-ssl keyword ensures the integrity and confidentiality of the transferred data by causing the LDAP client to establish a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) session prior to sending the bind or search request.

choices.C: feature-set hsrp interface vlan100 ip address 10.1.1.2 255.255.255.0 priority 80 preempt hsrp version 2 hsrp 1000 ip 10.1.1.1
choices.D: feature hsrp interface vlan100 ip address 10.1.1.2 255.255.255.0 priority 240 preempt hsrp version 2 hsrp 1000 ip 10.1.1.1
choices.A: feature hsrp interface vlan100 ip address 10.1.1.2 255.255.255.0 priority 255 preempt hsrp version 2 hsrp 1000 ip 10.1.1.1
choices.B: feature-set hsrp interface vlan100 ip address 10.1.1.2 255.255.255.0 priority 20 preempt hsrp version 2 hsrp 1000 ip 10.1.1.1

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure a Nexus 7000 series switch for HSRP on VLAN 100. When fully functional, the router must be the active master. Which set of commands must be used to implement the scenario?

discussion.content: The correct answer is A since the highest priority will become the active device into HSRP cluster. The priority range is 1 - 255.

Selected Answer: A
I think the correct way is like below:
ip add: 10.10.32.121/29
point-to-point
ip pim sparse-mode
interface Vlan110
no shutdown
no ip redirects
ip address 10.25.25.122/29
hsrp version 2
hsrp 110
preempt
priority 120 forwarding-threshold lower 1 upper 120
timers 1 3
ip 10.25.25.12

comments.content: the priority and preempt should come inside the hsrp mode

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

The default HSRP priority is 100. If you want an HSRP router to be elected as the active router, you should set the priority to a value higher than the default of 100.

feature hsrp 
interface vlan100 
ip address 10.1.1.2 255.255.255.0 
priority 255 
preempt 
hsrp version 2 
hsrp 1000 ip 10.1.1.1

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What is the result of implementing the configuration?

discussion.content:
Answer is C

Configuring RADIUS Server Hosts
To access a remote RADIUS server, you must configure the IP address or hostname of a RADIUS server. You can configure up to 64 RADIUS servers.

Note 
By default, when you configure a RADIUS server IP address or hostname of the Cisco NX-OS device, the RADIUS server is added to the default RADIUS server group. You can also add the RADIUS server to another RADIUS server group.

Note 
The local keyword is not supported (and is not required) when configuring AAA authentication groups because local authentication is the default if remote servers are unreachable. For example, if you configure aaa authentication login default group g1 , local authentication is tried if you are unable to authenticate using AAA group g1. In contrast, if you configure aaa authentication login default group g1 none , no authentication is performed if you are unable to authenticate using AAA group g1.

We have two Radius group default and Radius group.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, there are no fallback authentication specified in the AAA authentication

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, I agree with Annielover007

Selected Answer: D
A: the configured timeout is 15 seconds, not 15 milliseconds
B: the mgmt0 interface is used as source
C: No, because the "directed-request" function is not configured
D: CORRECT, since by default, NX-OS will fallback to local when remote authentication fails.
Therefore, answer D is correct.

Selected Answer: A

comments.content:
I don't think it will default to local that is why you need to enter the aaa config as 
aaa authentication login default group GROUP local
Nevermind...Time is configured in seconds, not miliseconds. None of these answers look to be correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. System will default to Local unless explicitly denied.

choices.B: RADIUS traffic is sourced from the VLAN 200 interface.
choices.D: Only the RADIUS server is used for authentication.
choices.C: Users specify the RADIUS server when they log in.
choices.A: The RADIUS server timeout value is 15 milliseconds.
